episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and historical topics, including the challenges of early photography, a secret society of journalists, the eccentricities of an 18th-century Swedish king, and the unusual practice of endoscopic tattooing.

facts.fact: To get a good close-up photo in the early 1900s, your camera had to be 20 feet long.
In America, there is a secret society called the Order of the Occult Hand whose sole mission is to sneak a very specific phrase into newspapers, and we have no idea what that phrase is.
18th-century King of Sweden Gustav III was into LARPing.
Some people have tattoos on the inside of their bottoms.
